intro: Senecio crithmoides, commonly known as the yellow pincushion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, yellow-orange spherical flower heads that resemble small pincushions. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are clustered together, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Senecio crithmoides is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that is well adapted to arid environments.
